intro: Sasamorpha purpurascens var. hidakana, commonly known as the Hidaka saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
